result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:35 AM Defendant Shayonna R Akers in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant states that she was unable to get form for court appointed counsel completed as she does not have an ID currently. 

Court passes case for the Defendant to complete form. 

Case re-called at 9:45 am. Same appearances as previously. 

Defendant sworn-in. Court questions defendant as to petition for court appointed counsel. 

Court approves appointment of counsel. Court sets repayment at $25/month, commencing on 11/01/2022. 

Court will set a date re: status of counsel. Address updated.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shayonna R Akers
Current: 1000 Pewaukee Rd, Apt #18, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-21-2022)
Prior: 1605 S. Prairie Ave., Waukesha, WI 53189

Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shayonna R Akers in court. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant states that she was not eligible for PD representation. Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states that she wants to be represented by an attorney. Court directs the Defendant to complete Court appointed Attorney paperwork. 

Court will set another date for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 06/21/22.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to physically discipline any minor.

01:57 PM Defendant Shayonna R Akers in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appearing in court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
